requirement-missing-powderflask: Missing powder flask or not enough powder in the flask
setting-comment-cursortype: Applied instantly, do not need world reload
itemdesc-firearm-pistol-steel:
Ammo: Bullet

Reload requires empty offhand.

Relatively weak but fast to reload. Can be shot from offhand. Carry a loaded pair for your wolf-problems.

Hold 'Alt' to interact instead of aim/reload.
itemdesc-firearm-pistol-*:
Ammo: Bullet

Requires cocking lever for priming. Reload requires empty offhand.

Relatively weak but fast to reload. Can be shot from offhand. Carry a loaded pair for your wolf-problems.

Bronze wheel-lock pistol. The wheel creates sparks when it rotates against a flint. The wheel is powered with clock spring. Copper alloys cannot produce sparks, so rusty gear is used for the wheel.

Hold 'Alt' to interact instead of aim/reload.
itemdesc-firearm-arquebus-*:
Ammo: Bullet

Requires lit match for shooting. Reload and aiming requires empty offhand.

Strong enough to one-shot a Ram, which makes hunting them much more convenient. Higher powder consumption, longer reload and need to have a lit match makes it less suitable for self-defense role than a pair of pistols.

Match-lock firearm of relatively simple construction. Smoldering match is used for igniting priming powder.

Hold 'Alt' to interact instead of aim/reload.
itemdesc-firearm-blunderbuss-steel:
Ammo: Pellet

Reload and aiming requires empty offhand.

Shoots 12 pellets in a narrow cone. Requires two waddings instead of one. Stronger than carbine if all pellets hit the target.Hold 'Alt' to interact instead of aim/reload.
itemdesc-firearm-blunderbuss-*iron:
Ammo: Pellet

Requires lit match for shooting. Reload and aiming requires empty offhand.

Shoots 8 pellets in a narrow cone. Requires two waddings instead of one. Stronger than arquebus if all pellets hit the target.

Match-lock firearm of relatively simple construction. Smoldering match is used for igniting priming powder.

Hold 'Alt' to interact instead of aim/reload.
itemdesc-firearm-musket-*:
Ammo: Slug

Reload and aiming requires empty offhand.

The strongest of firearms capable of one-shoting most of the enemies. Can be equipped with a bayonet (plug bayonet requires hammer in offhand to remove it). High powder consumption, very long reload and high cost makes it less economically viable for general use.

Smooth-bore flint-lock firearm with long barrel, capable of using a bayonet. The long barrel makes it longer to ram a bullet.

Hold 'Alt' to interact instead of aim/reload.
itemdesc-firearm-carbine-*:
Ammo: Slug

Reload and aiming requires empty offhand.

Not as strong as musket, but has faster reload and cheaper maintenance costs. Faster to aim and hinders movement less than a musket.

Smooth-bore flint-lock firearm with shortened barrel when compared to musket, which makes it lighter and faster to reload.

Hold 'Alt' to interact instead of aim/reload.
itemdesc-firearm-superimposed-*:
Ammo: Bullet

Requires cocking lever for priming. Reload requires empty offhand.

Relatively weak but has two bullets ready to shoot. You need to load both shots to be able to shoot. And you need to shoot both shots to be able to reload.

Two-shot superimposed load, wheel-lock carbine.

Hold 'Alt' to interact instead of aim/reload.
itemdesc-powderflask-*:
Stores gunpowder for use in firearms and protects it from water. Flask durability represents the amount of powder in the flask.

Take gunpowder into inventory and press right mouse button with flask to fill it.
itemdesc-cockinglever-*: Used to windup spring in wheel-lock pistol and bossi carbine
itemdesc-bayonet-socket-*:
Attack power (attached): -4.8 hp
Attack tier (attached): 5
Attack range (attached): 4 m

Can be attached to a musket to turn it into a spear. On melee attack, bayonet's durability is consumed instead of musket's

Socket style bayonet that uses a bayonet lug on a barrel. Allows to operate a gun while attached.

To attach/detach use hotkey ('B' by default).
itemdesc-slug-*: High caliber bullet used by musket and carbine.
itemdesc-bullet-*: Small caliber bullet used by pistol and arquebus.
itemdesc-pellet-*: Small caliber bullet used by blunderbuss.
blockdesc-weaponrack-*: For storing long firearms (musket, carbine, blunderbuss, arquebus).
blockdesc-wallmount-*: For storing long firearms (musket, carbine, blunderbuss, arquebus).
blockdesc-wallmountdouble-*: For storing long firearms (musket, carbine, blunderbuss, arquebus).
itemdesc-gunpowder-wet:
Intermediate step in gunpowder production.

Wet blasting powder formed into small granules. Blasting powder is too fine for using in firearms. It burns inconsistently.
itemdesc-gunpowder-coarse:
Intermediate step in gunpowder production.

Dried up granules of powder. Still not usable in firearms: they are too big and will burn slowly.
itemdesc-gunpowder-fine:
Powder suitable for using in firearms. Can become wet swimming with it in inventory.

Fine granules of powder of consistent size suitable for using in firearms. Such powder burns consistently and fast.
itemdesc-match-*: Required to be lit for firing arquebus. Will be extinguished when swimming.
itemdesc-lock-wheellock-*: Complex lock that produces sparks by rotating iron wheel against flint.
itemdesc-lock-matchlock-*: Simple lock that just connects a trigger lever to the liver that holds a smoldering match.
itemdesc-lock-flintlock-*: Advanced lock that requires steel and knowledge of producing good quality springs.
itemdesc-ramrod-*: Is used to ram bullet and wadding down the barrel and to compact powder.
itemdesc-schematic-flintlock: Ancient schematic that describes intricate production of a leaf spring and a ignition mechanism that utilizes it.
itemdesc-pouch-waist-plain: Can hold ammunition, powder flask, linen patches, match, cocking lever.
